info.title: RPC - Configuration Management
info.description:
Cisco IOS-XE RPC Operations - Config

**Category:** Config Operations
**Modules:** 4
**RPC Actions:** 14

**HTTP Methods:**
- POST: Execute RPC action/operation

**Modules Included:**
- ia
- netconf-diag
- transactions
- xcopy

**RPC Operation Pattern:**
RPC operations are executed via RESTCONF POST to `/operations/` endpoints.
Each RPC accepts input parameters and returns output results.

**Example RPC Execution:**
```bash
POST /restconf/operations/Cisco-IOS-XE-rpc:ping
Content-Type: application/yang-data+json

{
  "input": {
    "ping-request": {
      "destination": "10.0.0.1",
      "repeat-count": 5,
      "size": 100
    }
  }
}
```

**Example Response:**
```json
{
  "output": {
    "ping-reply": {
      "destination": "10.0.0.1",
      "request-count": 5,
      "reply-count": 5,
      "success-rate": 100,
      "minimum-rtt": 1,
      "average-rtt": 2,
      "maximum-rtt": 3
    }
  }
}
```

**Common Operations:**
- cisco_ia:sync-from
- cisco_ia:save-config
- cisco_ia:netconf-session-id
- cisco_ia:current-time
- cisco_ia:is-syncing
...

post.summary:
Synchronize the network element's
       running-configuration to ConfD.
post.description:
**Source Module:** ia

Synchronize the network element's
       running-configuration to ConfD.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cisco_ia:sync-from`

ignore-presrv-paths.description:
Sync everything under /native.
           Ignore any preserve paths.

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.summary:
Copy the running-config to
       startup-config on the Network
       Element.
post.description:
**Source Module:** ia

Copy the running-config to
       startup-config on the Network
       Element.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cisco_ia:save-config`

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.summary:
Returns device-assigned netconf session id for the
       netconf session in which this RPC is invoked.
post.description:
**Source Module:** ia

Returns device-assigned netconf session id for the
       netconf session in which this RPC is invoked.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cisco_ia:netconf-session-id`

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.description:
**Source Module:** ia

Returns current time on device.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cisco_ia:current-time`

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.summary:
Checks to see if sync from the
       network element to the running data store
       is in progress.
post.description:
**Source Module:** ia

Checks to see if sync from the
       network element to the running data store
       is in progress.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cisco_ia:is-syncing`

result.description: Output returned by the network element

syncing.description:
Network element to the data store sync is in progress or not.
         Configuration request through programmable interface may get rejected
         when sync is in progress.

syncs-pending.description:
Network element configurations need to be synced to the data store.
         Do not configure network element through programmable interface
         until all the pending configurations are synced to the data store.

running-datastore-locked.description:
Running datastore is locked preventing syncs.
         Sync will continue once lock is released.

candidate-datastore-locked.description:
Either candidate datastore is locked preventing syncs.
         Sync will continue once lock is released.
         This value is returned only in candidate datastore mode.

candidate-datastore-dirty.description:
Synchronization of the running configuration to the running
         datastore is deferred because the candidate datastore is dirty.
         Commit or discard the uncommitted configuration.
         This value is returned only in candidate datastore mode.

post.summary:
Create a configuration rollback checkpoint.
       Equivalent to the \
post.description:
**Source Module:** ia

Create a configuration rollback checkpoint.
       Equivalent to the \

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cisco_ia:checkpoint`

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.summary:
Cancel the timed rollback and trigger the
       rollback immediately, or to reset parameters
       for the timed rollback. If no input parameters
       are supplied, the timed rollback is cancelled
       and rollback is triggered immediately
post.description:
**Source Module:** ia

Cancel the timed rollback and trigger the
       rollback immediately, or to reset parameters
       for the timed rollback. If no input parameters
       are supplied, the timed rollback is cancelled
       and rollback is triggered immediately

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cisco_ia:revert`

now.description:
To cancel the timed rollback and
           trigger the rollback immediately

timer.description: Reset parameters for the timed rollback

idle.description:
Maximum allowable time period of no activity
           before reverting to the saved configuration.

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.summary:
Replaces the current running configuration
       file with a saved Cisco IOS XE configuration file.
post.description:
**Source Module:** ia

Replaces the current running configuration
       file with a saved Cisco IOS XE configuration file.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/cisco_ia:rollback`

target-url.description:
Cisco IOS XE configuration file that is to
           replace the current running configuration

verbose.description:
Display a list of the command lines applied by
           the Cisco IOS XE software parser during each pass
           of the configuration replace operation. The total
           number of passes performed is also displayed.

nolock.description:
Disables the locking of the running
           configuration file that prevents other users
           from changing the running configuration
           during a configuration replace operation.

revert-on-error.description:
Reverts to the original configuration upon
           error.

revert-timer.description:
Reverts to the original configuration if
           specified time elapses.

result.description: Output returned by the network element

post.summary:
Enable NETCONF Message Diagnostics for providing
       easy access to all information required to diagnose
       NETCONF transaction failures on NED models.
post.description:
**Source Module:** netconf-diag

Enable NETCONF Message Diagnostics for providing
       easy access to all information required to diagnose
       NETCONF transaction failures on NED models.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/netconf_diag_rpc:enable-netconf-diag`

**Source Module:** xcopy

Express copy action command

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/xcopy_rpc:xcopy`

uuid.description:
The UUID (universally unique identifier) is a string and is a textual
         representation of a UUID.
         UUID is used to uniquely identify the express copy action invoked via RPC
         and it is replayed back in the copy progress notifications to correlate
         them back to the original express copy operation.

source-path.description:
Source path:
         for download to device: scp://user:password@ipv4 address:/path/to/file
         or https://ipv4 address/path/to/file
         or http://ipv4 address/path/to/file
         or ftp://user:password@ipv4 address:/path/to/file
         for copy from device: /path/to/file in bootflash

destination-path.description:
Destination path:
         for copy to device: /path/to/file in bootflash

username.description: Username to be used for remote device

password.description: Password to be used for remote device

vrf.description:
VRF name instance to reach remote device.
         For management or global VRF leave this field blank other wise
         specify the IOS configured VRF name.

trustpoint.description:
Trust point of remote device configured in IOS.
         This is used to get the public key and provided to copy so that
         copy is more secured.

timeout.description:
Timeout period guarding express copy operation.
         If operation not completed, download will be aborted after this time.

uuid.description:
The UUID (universally unique identifier) is a string and is a textual
         representation of a UUID.

post.summary:
Name of the configuration datastore towards which the
           transaction is started.
post.description:
**Source Module:** transactions

Name of the configuration datastore towards which the
           transaction is started.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/tailf_netconf_transactions:start-transaction`

target.description:
Name of the configuration datastore towards which the
           transaction is started.

post.summary:
Prepares the transaction state for commit.  The server may reject
       the prepare request for any reason, for example due to lack of
       resources or if the combined changes would result in an invalid
       configuration datastore.

       After a successful <prepare-transaction>, the next transaction
       related rpc operation must be <commit-transaction> or
       <abort-transaction>.  Note that an <edit-config> cannot be sent
       before the transaction is either committed or aborted.

       Care must be taken by the server to make sure that if
       <prepare-transaction> succeeds then the <commit-transaction>
       SHOULD not fail, since this might result in an inconsistent
       distributed state.  Thus, <prepare-transaction> should allocate
       any resources needed to make sure the <commit-transaction> will
       succeed.

       If there is no ongoing transaction in this session, or if the
       ongoing transaction already has been prepared, an error MUST be
       returned with <error-app-tag> set to 'bad-state'.
post.description:
**Source Module:** transactions

Prepares the transaction state for commit.  The server may reject
       the prepare request for any reason, for example due to lack of
       resources or if the combined changes would result in an invalid
       configuration datastore.

       After a successful <prepare-transaction>, the next transaction
       related rpc operation must be <commit-transaction> or
       <abort-transaction>.  Note that an <edit-config> cannot be sent
       before the transaction is either committed or aborted.

       Care must be taken by the server to make sure that if
       <prepare-transaction> succeeds then the <commit-transaction>
       SHOULD not fail, since this might result in an inconsistent
       distributed state.  Thus, <prepare-transaction> should allocate
       any resources needed to make sure the <commit-transaction> will
       succeed.

       If there is no ongoing transaction in this session, or if the
       ongoing transaction already has been prepared, an error MUST be
       returned with <error-app-tag> set to 'bad-state'.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/tailf_netconf_transactions:prepare-transaction`

post.summary:
Applies the changes made in the transaction to the configuration
       datatore.  The transaction is closed after a <commit-transaction>.

       If there is no ongoing transaction in this session, or if the
       ongoing transaction already has not been prepared, an error
       MUST be returned with <error-app-tag> set to 'bad-state'.
post.description:
**Source Module:** transactions

Applies the changes made in the transaction to the configuration
       datatore.  The transaction is closed after a <commit-transaction>.

       If there is no ongoing transaction in this session, or if the
       ongoing transaction already has not been prepared, an error
       MUST be returned with <error-app-tag> set to 'bad-state'.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/tailf_netconf_transactions:commit-transaction`

post.summary:
Aborts the ongoing transaction, and all pending changes are
       discarded.  <abort-transaction> can be given at any time during an
       ongoing transaction.

       If there is no ongoing transaction in this session, an error MUST
       be returned with <error-app-tag> set to 'bad-state'.
post.description:
**Source Module:** transactions

Aborts the ongoing transaction, and all pending changes are
       discarded.  <abort-transaction> can be given at any time during an
       ongoing transaction.

       If there is no ongoing transaction in this session, an error MUST
       be returned with <error-app-tag> set to 'bad-state'.

**Endpoint:** `POST /restconf/operations/tailf_netconf_transactions:abort-transaction`
